item.title: Medha add a quote by William Shakespeare
Medha add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "Worry does not empty tomorrow of its sorrow, it empties today of its strength." -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: Medha add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "After nourishment, shelter and companionship, stories are the thing we need most in the world." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Medha add a quote by Ovid
item.description: "Chance is always powerful. Let your hook be always cast; in the pool where you least expect it, there will be a fish." -- Ovid

item.title: Medha add a quote by Lawrence Ferlinghetti
item.description: "Poetry is eternal graffiti written in the heart of everyone." -- Lawrence Ferlinghetti

item.title: Medha add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Medha add a quote by Charlotte Bronte
item.description: "Happiness quite unshared can scarcely be called happiness; it has no taste." -- Charlotte Bronte

item.title: Medha add a quote by Anthony Trollope
item.description: "A small daily task, if it be really daily, will beat the labours of a spasmodic Hercules." -- Anthony Trollope

item.title: Medha add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Medha add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Perhaps it's impossible to wear an identity without becoming what you pretend to be." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Medha add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "In vain have I struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Medha add a quote by Lloyd Alexander
item.description: "Child, child, do you not see? For each of us comes a time when we must be more than what we are." -- Lloyd Alexander

item.title: Medha add a quote by Betty Friedan
item.description: "Aging is not 'lost youth' but a new stage of opportunity and strength." -- Betty Friedan
